alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:58AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHERN GRANT, NORTH CENTRAL OWEN, NORTHERN PENDLETON, CENTRAL GALLATIN, CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 230 AM EDT... At 158 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Blanchester to near Patriot, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Independence, Alexandria, Walton, Claryville, Amelia, Crittenden, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Dry Ridge, Batavia, Sardinia, Felicity, Butler, Withamsville, Ryland Heights, Owensville, Hamersville and Glencoe. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 59 and 70. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 159 and 171. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
